publicationstmt.publisher: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-04-05 20:25:31 -0400.

repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection contains some restricted material. Restrictions related to specific material are listed in the detailed contents list. This collection may require review before it is available for use. Please contact DCA for further details.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into three series: Publications; 2017 accessions; and 2018 accessions.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: In 1984, The Gordon Institute is founded by Dr. Bernard Gordon, founder of Analogic Corporation and NeuroLogica Corps. The Gordon Institute is one of the first educational institutions designed and developed specifically to create engineering leaders. From 1984 to 1987, The Institutes mission, curriculum, and policies are developed and the School prepares for accreditation by the New England Association of Schools and Colleges (NEASC). In 1987, The first class of seven students graduates from The Gordon Institute. In 1991, The NEASC accredits The Gordon Institute to confer the degree of Master of Science in Engineering Management. In 1992, The Gordon Institute merges with Tufts University. In 2001, Tufts Gordon Institute assumes responsibility for Tufts Entrepreneurial Leadership Program. In doing so, the Institute broadens its mission to encompass innovation and entrepreneurship as well as engineering leadership.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Gordon Institute Records, 1987-1999. Tufts University. Digital Collections and Archives. Medford, MA.

processinfo.head: Processing status
processinfo.p: Processing of the 2017 and 2018 accessions was completed by Leah Edelman and Sony Prosper in 2017-2018. Materials were placed in archival boxes if the original housing was damaged, and loose materials were placed in folders where needed. Received order was maintained. A file-level and box-level inventory as well as series-level description were created and the finding aid was updated at the time of processing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains pamphlets created by the Gordon Institute, as well as student records from before Tufts acquired the Gordon Institute of Wakefield, MA, and acquisitions files between Tufts and the Gordon Institute.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. Copyright to all materials created by Tufts University employees in the course of their work is held by the Trustees of Tufts University.

controlaccess.subject: Curriculum and Instruction -- Academic Centers and Institutes

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains two copies of a Gordon Institute pamphlet.

did.unittitle: Gordon Institute, Continuing Education for Engineering Management

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in received order. Student records are largely arranged alphabetically by last name.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This series contains some restricted material. Restrictions related to specific material are listed in the detailed contents list. This series may require review before it is available for use. Please contact DCA for further details.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by the Gordon Institute, 2017, accession UA-2018-037.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains student records from before Tufts acquired the Gordon Institute of Wakefield, MA; as well as acquisitions files between Tufts and the Gordon Institute, including reports to the NEASC, site visit information for the NEASC and the Board of Regents, and alumni files.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in received order.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records containing information related to student education, staff and faculty employment, and Board of Trustees records are closed for 75 years from the date of creation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains transcripts and student records from before Tufts acquired the Gordon Institute of Wakefield, MA; and may include acquisitions files between Tufts and the Gordon Institute.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by the Gordon Institute, 2018, accession UA-2018-046.
